biography.value: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

languages.custom: Understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

description.value: A lengthy straight blade designed for slashing foes, the longsword is a highly versatile weapon that may also be wielded with two hands for more punishing strikes.
A thick shaft of laminated wood is bowed by a taut string capable of launching deadly arrows at long distances.
This one-handed axe is light and balanced for throwing while remaining useful in hand combat.
This one-handed axe is light and balanced for throwing while remaining useful in hand combat.

This one-handed axe is light and balanced for throwing while remaining useful in hand combat.

Whether through demonic blessing, celestial bequeathment, crazed experiment, or skillful craft, this weapon has been enhanced to bring more bloodshed by the bearer.

You have a bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
This one-handed axe is light and balanced for throwing while remaining useful in hand combat.

effects.name: Magic Weapon, +1
effects.description: This weapon becomes a magic weapon with a +1 bonus to Attack rolls and Damage Rolls.

unidentified.name: Unidentified Handaxe

description.value: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
This one-handed axe is light and balanced for throwing while remaining useful in hand combat.
